title: Is virtue a moral virtue? - Quora

response.answer_text: No. What virtues do is determine a person’s character (which is also determined by things like temperament and personality traits). Virtues are considered essential to living the best possible life available to you, but having virtues is not itself a virtue. Your particular society and historical era determine what virtues are valued / rewarded / encouraged. Obviously, since the whole notion of virtues arose in Greece and Rome long ago, they made distinctions as to the virtues that any human being (men, women, slaves) can have (or lack), the virtues appropriate for free men (“citizens” in modern parlance), and the virtues best suited to different classes or professions (courage is an important virtue for the warrior class but not so important for merchants, industriousness is a virtue in a slave but not so important for artists).
